item.title: Road floods, 30th August
item.description:

item.title: Tree needs pruning to improve visibility for pedestrians using refuge, 30th August
item.description:
The tree on the north side of the refuge / traffic island across Foxgrove Road near the crossroads with Westgate Road needs to be pruned. When trying to cross from north to south, visibility along Foxgrove Road towards the west i.e. where traffic comes from is very poor. You can barely see the 10m to the crossroads.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxgrove Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Inappropriate placement of litter bin placed within and in front private property space_it should be removed immediately, 30th August
item.description:
I'm a Leaseholder and resident of Claremont House, a private building. The last few weeks I observed a litter bin was arbitrarily placed in front of our building and next to flower beds, not only compromising the looks of the building but more importantly raising a number of serious Heath and Safety risks. For your information, all the terrace and pavement space around the building including the flower beds are private property and the placent of any bins or any other objects is strictly prohibited. You can easily move the bin in any other space across Quebec Way street, but excluding the whole space around Claremont House building. Can you please remove the litter bin as soon as possible from there?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Quebec Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
